revised_title: Influence of Pressure on the Ignitibility of Carbon Monoxide and Oxygen Mixtures
tldr: The authors conducted experiments to study the combustion of carbon monoxide and oxygen mixtures under different pressures. They found that at pressures below 2 atmospheres, the mixtures could not be ignited. At initial pressures between 2.75 and 5 atmospheres, ignition was possible but combustion was not always complete. At pressures of 10 atmospheres or more, the mixture ignited instantly.
